actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.

official_title: A bill to establish a Federal matching grant program for State and local law enforcement agencies to assist in upgrading firearms, providing training, and purchasing ammunition.
subjects: Federal aid to law enforcement agencies

summary.text: Law Enforcement Officer Protection Act - Directs the Attorney General to establish a Federal matching grant program to provide financial assistance to State and local law enforcement agencies for the purpose of upgrading or converting their standard-issue firearms, purchasing ammunition, and providing training. Authorizes the Attorney General to make a single grant to a State or local agency in an amount, not to exceed $300,000, equal to the amount of non-Federal funds expended by or committed to the agency for the purpose of upgrading or converting firearms on or after March 15, 1994, and before March 15, 1995. Authorizes appropriations.

titles.title: A bill to establish a Federal matching grant program for State and local law enforcement agencies to assist in upgrading firearms, providing training, and purchasing ammunition.
